page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: The dominant feature in the area is the Englefield Estate, which has at ita centre a house and a deer park. The Estate built and owns Englefield village and owns almost all of the farmland. The area contains the rivers Pang and Bourne and their vallies, hence giving the area its undulating characteristic. The village of Bradfield is dominated by its independent boys boarding school. There is a comprehensive and two primary schools in the area. The workhouse at Bradfield is now used as a mental hospital largely catering for mentally handicapped adults. The main north-south road, the A340, carries traffic between Pangbourne and Theale. It crosses the M4 which runs east-west through the area but has no access points. In the north of the area there is a Nature Conservancy area.
